I wrote some tests for the org.eclipse.jdt.compiler.tool plugin inside the org.eclipse.jdt.compiler.tool.tests project. Since this project requires a 1.6 VM, I decided to use JUnit4 to write my regression test.
Everything works fine inside Eclipse, but when I try to use the Eclipse test framework it doesn't work anymore.
It is expecting a test class written using JUnit3. I tried defining the backward compatible method suite() inside my test class, but I get ClassCastExceptions at runtime.
It seems that the junit.framework.Test class is not the "right" one.
I think we should investigate how to make the test framework aware of two JUnit plugins. If a project defines or uses JUnit4, the appropriate runner should be used by the framework.

I think this is related to the way the org.eclipse.ant.optional.junit fragment is setup.  I think org.junit4 needs to be added to it's dependency list.  Will test locally to see if this does the trick.

This should be fixed, as more and more test are written for JUnit4
